name: Angela Zavaleta Bernuy
content: Angela's Page > About I am an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computing and Software at McMaster University. I recently completed my Ph.D. in Computer Science at the University of Toronto, supervised by ACM's Distinguished Professor Andrew Petersen. My research revolves around Computing Education and Human-Computer Interaction, with a primary focus on real-world experimentation and interdisciplinary collaboration. With the use of innovative methodologies such as A/B testing and adaptive interventions, I aim to learn more about students' experiences and behaviours within the computing education setting. Through responsible experimentation and data-driven analysis, my research ultimately strives to create more effective and engaging learning experiences for computing students. When I am not writing papers, conducting studies, or teaching, you can probably find me playing tennis, on twitter or building lego flowers. Education Doctor of Philosophy of Computer Science University of Toronto - June 2025 Master of Computer Science University of Toronto - January 2022 Honours Bachelor of Science Co-op Software Engineering and Mathematics University of Toronto - April 2020 Awards Best Paper Award ACM's SIGITE - September 2022 Undergraduate Research Award University of Toronto - April 2020 Publications and Talks You can find my most up-to-date list of publications in my Google Scholar page.
